T H E   M O V I E

Based on the novel "Dievu miskas" by Balys Sruoga

COUNTRY: Lithuania
DIRECTOR: Algimantas Puipa
SCREENWRITER: Ricardas Gavelis, Algimantas Puipa
CINEMATOGRAPHER: Algimantas Mikutenas
CAST: Valentinas Masalskis, Steven Berkoff, Robertas Urbonas, Robertas Urbonas
STUDIO/PRODUCER: Baltic Film Group / IMS 6 LLP

This film, with its unusual style and original direction, tells a story about
a man who is an artist and a thinker, who remained an unbreakable prisoner of
two different regimes - Soviet and Nazi.

The main character of the film - "the Professor" - lives in his own inner
dialogue with his own principles of morality and truth.  After being
imprisoned in a German concentration camp, he becomes a part of the drama of
the condemned.  Irony helps him survive the extreme situation and distances
him from the cruel reality.  Back from the concentration camp, the professor
writes a memoir where he writes about death, but the Soviets censor it. The
so-called Soviet "freedom" becomes just as much a challenge as the German
concentration camp.
